Hemor Be well assurd the match I'l further so farforth as I can & there of will to Iacob speake, the whyle let's in agayne. Iacob I heare sichem my Daughter hath abus'd, yet I'l be silent vntyll my sonnes from the field come. & lo now are they present Sonns do you heare how foule a thinge Sichem hath done in Israell Ruben Father we do, & on hym we'l reuenge our Sisters quarell. Hemor Iacob the soule of my sonne Sichem's fastned to your Daughter where fore let hym haue her to wyfe, & let's one match wt h th'other Geue vs your daughters, & take ours to you yf that you please & dwell wt h vs & till our land, & you shall yt possesse. Sichem Let vs but fynde grace in your sight, & looke what Dowry s'euer you shall demaund, yt shall be geuen: only geue me your daughter Simeon We can not her bestow on an vncircumcised person wc h amongst vs vnlawfull ys, and a great abomination But if you'l be lyke vs, & all the males be circumcised amongst you, then shall mariages be twene vs be solemnized, & we will dwell wt h you, & as one people lyue to gether But yf you'l not be circumcis'd we'l from you fetch our Sister. Hemor Your offer pleaseth vs right well, where fore we will be gone & circumcise the males that are amongst vs euery one. Simeon Fare well, & when that you haue done, we'l meete you here agayne. All that we sayd was but in guyle, & yet yt made fooles fayne father will yt not please you now agayne in for to walke Iacob. Yes, come, let's go that we about this busines may talke. Simeon Brother Leui this the third day ys since they were circumcised So that their wounds are now at sor'st, & there wt h they most payned wherefore let vs boldly sett vpon the citty & them morder Not spareinge one of the male sex, & bringe away our sister Iudas Now haue our brothers Simeon & Leui wt h their parttakers slayne all the male Sex wt h in the citty, & spared neuer a man Not so much as Hemor & Sichem but haue them both murdered & out of Sichems house our sister Dina also conveyed. And now let vs go spoyle the citty in reuenge of the rape & wayst their howses fields, & catle, & let nothinge escape. but captyue lead away wt h vs their litle ones, & theyr wyues Isachar, Zabulon etc. Content, syth there vnto the foulnes of the fact vs dryues. Ada Woes vs pore soules! For one mans fault must all we thus be punished? Our husbands slayne, we captyues lead, & our whole citty spoyled This is to great seuerity for one fault, though most heynous & vnto you who tooke this prize, yt can not be but daungerous where fore some pitty on vs take, as pittyed you would bee yf you should fall (as fortune's mutable) in to lyke kynde of misery Isachar No mercy will we shew, but as Sichem hath wrong'd vs all by the rape of our only sister, So shall you greate & small for this only offence be plagud wherefore your pratinge leaue, & go wt h vs, for as you haue deseru'd, you shall receiue. Ada Some mercy shew: some pitty take vpon vs wretched people. Yf not on vs, yet on our children that are both yonge & litle. Zabulon You do but spend your words in vayne for no sparke of compassion wee'l shew to any, whether yonge or old, & therefore hence be gone. Iacob Sonnes I perceiue you haue both troubled me, & made me odious vnto the chananites, & the pheresits, for you were ouer rigorous in punishinge my daughters rape, though the offence was worthy of sharp reuenge because they dyd abuse her so notoriously for you can not be ignorant, but must needes vnderstand that we are few, they many, & the Inhabiters of this land & gatheringe of their powers together may at their pleasures strike mee & so I & my house in one day shall destroyed bee. Ruben Why did they then abuse our sister as she had bene a strumpet? Iacob The wrong'd her much I do confesse: but now let's that forgett & towards Bethell forthwt h go, as god hath me commanded & there an Altar buyld to hym, where he to me appeared when I from Esau fled, & heard me in my tribulation Simeon Do as yt lykes you best, wee'l attend on you euery one. Omar Now Iacob & his sonnes, on whom we would haue bene reuenged for the great slaughter they haue made amongst vs are departed & such a terrour generally in vaded hath our citties that we dare not pursue them goinge for to requit the iniuryes wc h they haue to vs done, but letten them quietly depart though to our vtter shame, such terrour hath possest our hart. & thus much for [to] say I blush, although in truth yt's so & yet we know no cause of feare. but now hence must I go. Iacob In Bethel now we are aryu'd, where I haue buylt an Altar & cal'd yt, House of god, for there to me he dyd appeare & now me thinks I heare his voyce agayne: yt's the self same. God Hence forth no more Iacob, but Israell shall be thy name. Israel I am god almighty: do thou increase & multiply: Out of thy loyns shall kings proceede, & nations shall come of the & the land wc h I vnto Abraham & Isaac gaue in former tymes, both thou & thy seede after thee shall haue Iacob Moust humble thanks my gracious lord I vnto the do render Now will I vnto mambre go there for to see my father. As by the way I and my family went, Rachel my wyfe in trauell fell, & dyd bringe forth a sonne, wc h cost her lyfe & Benoni she did hym call, that's the sonne of my payne whom Beniamin, that's sonne of the right hand I nam'd agayne And when that I had her inter'd I to my father went wt h my twelue sonnes & daughter, & found hym aged, weak & impotent for wc h I sory was, yet did my will to gods resigne & he fell sicke & dyed, when I a while had wt h hym bene beinge one hundred yeares & eighty old, whom we two brothers Esau & I interd after the fashion of our fore fathers And after that the days of mourninge for his death were ended at sundry tyme in frendly wyse we on the other visited & in his wonted maner now I see hym cominge hither Esau How do you brother? I sory am we can not dwell together any longer tyme here in chanaan our flockes are so increased that one land can not beare them all but they must needs be parted where fore I'l take my wyues, & sonnes & daughters & whole family & all my wealth, & in mou[n]t Seir go dwell an other country & leaue for you & for your wyues, children & flocks this land Iacob Thankes Brother, & to my smale power I'l be at your command Esau well then I'l take my leave of you, though wt h great griefe of heart for loath I am yf I could choose from you for to depart Iacob And I from you, but syth together we can no longer stay I'l go alonge wt h you for to conduct you on the way.
